page.title: 09LIFE ON A TURKEY FARM
page.content: This is an ordinary Tuesday on a turkey farm. My dad gets in the tractor and drives it to the bottom of the yard and parks it next to the feeding bins. He gets some bags and fills them up with turkey food which is pellets and sometimes small pieces of gravel. He then loads it on to the tractor and drives the tractor to the top of the yard and parks next to the gate and unloads the turkey food. Then he opens the gate and takes the food in one bag at a time and puts it into little bins. When the bags are empty he puts them back on the tractor then he does it three or four times again. When he has finished he parks the tractor. Next a person comes and parks his car and goes into the feather room (which is where all the feathers are
